name: Yong Siew Toh Conservatory of Music

reviews.text:
Off the beaten track but a great place to enjoy a concert. The lighting and accoustics enlivened the performance.

The first row of seats at the balcony (row AA) had an obstructed viewing due to the metal bars in front. Unfortunately this information is not being communicated on their booking map, so watch out!

Nice one lah
Watched "Mostly Mozart" performance
Very high quality and professional performance
3 Encore pieces (the one in the recording is the second encore piece)
Also just 5 dollars (for students or senior citizens) or 10 dollars (normal price) for one performance

Yong Siew Toh Conservatory of Music offers an incredible experience for music lovers. The performance I attended was outstanding, showcasing immense talent in a warm and inspiring environment. The acoustics were excellent, and the venue itself is well-designed and welcoming. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable musical experience!

I cried at the last piece of music performance...

It was one of those journeys of life where I picked one of the students from the school. She (Ms Sim) was on the way for her class and she shared to me that she was performing in the Asian Civilisation Museum. A small ensemble and I just can't miss it.

I think it was divine appointment when I checked the website there are 4 tickets left. I quickly booked one and then decided to stop working and went home to cleaned myself up. Later, I checked the same website, all the tickets are gone.

When the students start playing, instantly I was totally drawn into the music. Every pieces of music performed on that afternoon were marvellous, some classics of the 1800s and pre war music.

It was then the last piece by Kevin McKee - iron horse that has impacted me deeply. It was so moving and it brought tears to my eyes. I have been so moved by music before. Bravo to the school, teachers and students.

Attending 13th international choral festival and was amazed by this nice concert hall . And like the various art pieces place around the venue too. But was shock and taken back that being a conservatory hall at NUS , a clearly spoilt TV was broadcasting the live festival for those international participants while waiting outsideâ€¦ very disappointed on that.
